record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name=NULL and term="Edit existing key" and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"

brief.brief: To modify an existing key in the dbdict record, use the position the cursor at the key line (+++++++++++++) above the key you want to edit, and press F2 (Edit Field or Key).
To change the data type, press F5 (Change Type) to access a list of the available data types.
Select a data type from the list and press Enter.
Service Manager automatically displays the newly selected data type in the Edit Field Window.

detail.detail: You may manually type any number of key field names into the field names array, or select them one at a time from the fields array by positioning the cursor at the field name and pressing Enter.
Press F5 (Select Type) to access a list of available key types.
Select the key type you want to use and press Enter.
Service Manager displays the new key type in the Edit Key Window.
At this point, you may add a new key, edit another key, close the Edit Key window, delete a key, change the displayed key type, or retrieve the next or previous key for editing.
